title: Second suspect named in New Iberia shooting
content:
UPDATE 3:19 p.m.
Police have secured a warrant for a second suspect in a Sunday night shooting of a 17-year-old.
Bryan Dugas is wanted for accesstory after the fact to attempted second-degree murder and obstruction of justice. Dugas, described as a 20-year-old black man, 5 feet, 10 inches and 180 pounds, is believed to be an associate of Courtney Washington, who is wanted for attempted second-degree murder.
Anyone with information on either suspect is asked to contact the Iberia Parish Sheriff's Office at 337-369-3711.
ORIGINAL STORY
Investigators with the Iberia Parish Sheriff's Office are looking for a man in connection with a shooting Sunday night.
According to a press release from IPSO, Courtney Washington has been identified as the person allegedly responsible for the shooting of a 17-year-old Sunday night on Ambassador W. Lemelle Drive in New Iberia.
Washington is described as a black male, 6 feet, 5 inches tall weighing 195 pounds. He wears eyeglasses with thick lenses.
Washington should be considered armed and dangerous, the press release says. Anyone with information on his whereabouts is encouraged to contact IPSO at 337-369-3711.
